Method Detail

connect

public StatusMessage connect(java.lang.String url,
                             java.lang.Object androidcontext)
connect to the url and get the output message (via unsecured GET method)

Specified by:
connect in interface DeviceConnectionInterface
Parameters:
url - the url to connect
androidcontext - the Android context of the mobile application activity's class (to access the device connection status)
Returns:
StatusMessage indicates the connect operation status (success, failed, error etc...)
  • if the connection was successful
    return: StatusMessage(true,[message from the server])
  • if the connection was unavailable (no signal or no internet connection)
    return: StatusMessage(false,"checkconnection: Network Connection is Unavailable")
  • if the connection was error
    return: StatusMessage(false,"connect: Message is sent/No Response")
    See Also:
    android.content.Context, StatusMessage

    • sslpost

    public StatusMessage sslpost(java.lang.String url,
                             java.lang.String uid,
                             java.lang.String token,

    Specified by:
    sslpost in interface DeviceConnectionInterface
    Parameters:
    url - the url to connect
    uid - user id or device id
    token - the Token to register
    androidcontext - the Android context of the mobile application activity's class (to access the device connection status)
    Returns:
    StatusMessage indicate the sslpost operation status (success, failed, error etc...) (***return null)
    See Also:
    android.content.Context, StatusMessage

    checkconnection

    public StatusMessage checkconnection(java.lang.Object androidcontext)
    check whether the device is connected to the Internet

    Specified by:
    checkconnection in interface DeviceConnectionInterface
    Parameters:
    androidcontext - the Android context of the mobile application activity's class (to access the device connection status)
    Returns:
    StatusMessage indicate the checkconnection operation status (success, failed, error etc...)
  • if the connection was available
    return: StatusMessage(true,"checkconnection: Network Connection is OK")
  • if the connection was unavailable (no signal or no internet connection)
    return: StatusMessage(false,"checkconnection: Network Connection is Unavailable")
    See Also:
    android.content.Context, StatusMessage
